title: Moroccan Chicken Tagine with Root Vegetables & Couscous
description: A traditional Moroccan chicken tagine featuring seasoned chicken legs, root vegetables, and chickpeas slow-cooked with aromatic spices. Served over fluffy couscous. (Serves 5)

ingredients.name: Fresh cilantro or parsley, chopped (for garnish)

steps: Pat the chicken legs dry and season generously with salt, black pepper, ground cumin, and paprika.
In a Dutch oven, heat olive oil over medium heat. Brown the chicken on all sides in batches if needed, then remove and set aside.
In the same pot, add a little more olive oil if necessary and sauté the sliced onions until soft and golden.
Add the minced garlic, ground cinnamon, and turmeric. Stir for about a minute until fragrant.
Toss in the chopped carrots, parsnips (or sweet potato), and drained chickpeas. Stir well to coat with the spices.
Nestle the browned chicken legs back into the pot and add the chicken broth—just enough to mostly cover the contents.
If using, add a few chopped dried apricots or slices of preserved lemon for extra depth.

Bring to a gentle simmer. Cover and let it cook over low heat for 1.5 to 2 hours, or until the chicken is very tender and the flavors are rich. (Optional: Remove the lid during the last 15–20 minutes to slightly reduce the sauce.)
Prepare the couscous: In a bowl, combine 1 cup couscous with 1 cup boiling water, a pinch of salt, and a drizzle of olive oil or a knob of butter. Cover for 5 minutes, then fluff with a fork.
Serve the chicken tagine over the couscous and top with chopped fresh cilantro or parsley.
